properties.apiRevisionDescription: removing mocked resp from CDC Acccount API getcustomerstatus

id.description: Unique identifier for the given user.

emailVerified.description: Set to true if the user's email has been verified.

createDate.description: The date that the user was created.

properties.description:
https://accounts.au1.gigya.com/accounts.resendVerificationCode

This method is used to resend a validation email to unverified addresses associated with the account.

# Parameters required for this REST API

UID - The unique ID of a logged-in user. This is the UID you receive from Gigya after a successful login of this user.
apiKey - Unique API Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
secret - Secret key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
userKey - User Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console

The apiKey, secret and userKey are environment specific and are created and maintained in the CDC console. Please reach out to the CDC admin team for access to these keys per environment. The integrator or team implementing this API call must reach out to the CDC team and get the information on these keys. 


# Please refer CDC documentation here for more information,
https://help.sap.com/viewer/8b8d6fffe113457094a17701f63e3d6a/GIGYA/en-US/4138f19d70b21014bbc5a10ce4041860.html

This method resets a user's password, either via email or directly. The email format is according to the templates defined in the site policy. 

# Request URL

https://accounts.<Data_Center>/accounts.resetPassword

Where <Data_Center> is: au1.gigya.com - For the Australian data center.

# Parameters

Make an intial request to this API to get the reset password token

loginID - The email ID of the user.
sendEmail - false
apiKey - Unique API Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
secret - Secret key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
userKey - User Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console

Make a subsequent request to reset the password for this user 

loginID - The email ID of the user.
passwordResetToken - Password token received from the response of the first request. 
newPassword - new password in plain text form.
apiKey - Unique API Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
secret - Secret key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
userKey - User Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console


#Refer CDC documentation for more details

https://help.sap.com/viewer/8b8d6fffe113457094a17701f63e3d6a/GIGYA/en-US/559574624b634e5a955e0f7eeba01c07.html

Searches and retrieves data from Gigya's Accounts Storage using an SQL-like query. SQL queries are converted into Gigya's proprietary query language. SQL injection attacks are not possible because queries are both created by the customer and then converted by Gigya.

# Example request below

# Define the API and Secret key (the keys can be obtained from your site setup page in the Gigya console).
# Enter the proper Data center (us1, eu1, au1) if not using us1.
# Requests include a secret and MUST be sent over SSL.

# You can copy and import the code below directly into Postman.

curl -X POST \
    https://accounts.gigya.com/accounts.search \
    -H 'content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    --data-urlencode "apiKey=[Enter-Your-API-Key-Here]" \
    --data-urlencode "secret=[Enter-Your-Secret-Key]" \
    --data-urlencode "userKey=[Enter-Your-User-Key]" \
    --data-urlencode "query=SELECT * FROM accounts WHERE profile.gender='m' AND profile.age > 25" \
    
# Parameters 

UID - The unique ID of a logged-in user. This is the UID you receive from Gigya after a successful login of this user.
apiKey - Unique API Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
secret - Secret key per environment. This is available from the CDC console.
userKey - User Key per environment. This is available from the CDC console
    
The apiKey, secret and userKey are environment specific and are created and maintained in the CDC console. Please reach out to the CDC admin team for access to these keys per environment. The integrator or team implementing this API call must reach out to the CDC team and get the information on these keys.
To complete the eBill onboarding process for the eBill user who is logging in for the first time after account is migrated.

properties.value:
<!--
    IMPORTANT:
    - Policy elements can appear only within the <inbound>, <outbound>, <backend> section elements.
    - To apply a policy to the incoming request (before it is forwarded to the backend service), place a corresponding policy element within the <inbound> section element.
    - To apply a policy to the outgoing response (before it is sent back to the caller), place a corresponding policy element within the <outbound> section element.
    - To add a policy, place the cursor at the desired insertion point and select a policy from the sidebar.
    - To remove a policy, delete the corresponding policy statement from the policy document.
    - Position the <base> element within a section element to inherit all policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Remove the <base> element to prevent inheriting policies from the corresponding section element in the enclosing scope.
    - Policies are applied in the order of their appearance, from the top down.
    - Comments within policy elements are not supported and may disappear. Place your comments between policy elements or at a higher level scope.
-->
<policies>
	<inbound>
		<base />
		<set-backend-service id="apim-generated-policy" backend-id="func-cdc-login" />
	</inbound>
	<backend>
		<base />
	</backend>
	<outbound>
		<base />
	</outbound>
	<on-error>
		<base />
	</on-error>
</policies>

properties.description: Get Account Information for a user account from CDC
To get additional status details for a SW user account.

properties.description: This API allows retrieval of the public key necessary for validating an id_token returned from the accounts.getJWT API endpoint. As a public endpoint, this API requires no parameters, including a secret or userKey/secret pair, and only the API key of the site for which to retrieve the public key.

This method sets account data into a user's account. The method accepts a list of optional parameters each defining a field/object in the account. The parameters that are passed in the request modify the relevant fields, and the other fields remain unchanged.
